nmgr.network-manager.vlanId.label: VLAN ID
nmgr.network-settings.title: Network settings
nmgr.network-settings.patMtuDiscovery.in: Path MTU Discovery (PMTUD) dynamically determines the maximum packet size a network path can handle. The sender starts with an assumed MTU, adjusts based on feedback (ICMP "Fragmentation Needed" messages), and iterates until finding the optimal size, minimizing fragmentation for efficient data transmission.
nmgr.network-settings.bandwidthManagemen: Please note that an interface can only be assigned to one bandwidth
Name is invalid (must start with a letter and may than contain these characters: a-z, A-Z, 0-9, - and _)
A bandwidth with this name already exists
Description contains invalid characters (not allowed are \, [], {} and ")
nmgr.network-settings.dan.title: Double Attached Node (DAN)
nmgr.network-settings.dan.info: Double Attached Nodes improve network reliability with HSR or PRP protocols. HSR provides seamless redundancy in a ring, but requires more bandwidth. PRP provides zero downtime using two networks, but requires duplicate hardware.
nmgr.network-settings.dan.hint: Available are Ethernet interfaces that are not already used by another interface and are not configured externally
nmgr.hosts.title: Hosts
nmgr.hosts.dialog.edithost.title: Edit host
nmgr.hosts.dialog.addhost.title: Add host
nmgr.validation.hostnameTooLong.message: Host name is too long (max. 253 characters)
nmgr.validation.hostnameInvalidCharacter: Host name contains invalid characters (allowed are a-z, A-Z, 0-9, '-', '_' and '.')
nmgr.validation.hostnameSegmentsEmpty.me: Segments of the host name must not be empty
nmgr.validation.hostnameSegmentTooLong.m: A host name segment is too long (max. 63 characters)
nmgr.validation.hostnameSegmentStartsWit: A host name segment must not start with a hyphen '-'
nmgr.hosts.dialog.addressNotUnique: A host entry with this address already exists
nmgr.hosts.expertsWarning: For experts only! The device might not be reachable anymore!
nmgr.networkDiscovery.upnp.tooltip: Universal Plug and Play (UPNP) provides a set of network protocols that allows other devices to find and communicate with this device on the network without requiring manual setup or configuration.
nmgr.networkDiscovery.mdns.tooltip: Multicast DNS (MDNS) is a protocol that allows devices to register their hostname and IP address and have this information queried by other devices. MDNS is used to publish the hostname and IP addresses of this device within a local network.
nmgr.networkDiscovery.mdns-resolver.tool: Multicast DNS Resolver (MDNS-RESOLVER) is a service that takes a domain name (.local) as input and resolves it to an IP address using MDNS.
nmgr.networkDiscovery.gratuitous-arp.too: Gratuitous Address Resolution Protocol (GRATUITOUS-ARP) is a service in which a device sends an ARP request to update the ARP cache of other devices on the network. It helps to maintain efficient and accurate communication in a network.
nmgr.networkDiscovery.llmnr.tooltip: Link-Local Multicast Name Resolution (LLMNR) is a protocol for resolving host names to IP addresses on a local area network without requiring DNS servers when traditional DNS resolution fails. It allows other devices on a local network segment to perform name resolution for it on the same local link.
nmgr.networkDiscovery.enable.tooltip:
Enable: The service is started and Autostart is enabled. 
Disable: The service is stopped and Autostart is disabled.
nmgr.networkDiscovery.error.switch: Error when enabling or disabling the service
nmgr.networkDiagnostics.ping.title: Ping
nmgr.networkDiagnostics.greaternull.erro: Please enter a number greater than 0
nmgr.networkDiagnostics.ping.info: Ping is a networking tool used to check the connection between two devices by sending a small packet of data and measuring the response time. No response indicates that the IP address is currently unavailable. However, some server administrators block the ping response mechanism to prevent devices from being flooded with ping commands.
nmgr.networkDiagnostics.arp.error: Please enter a valid IPv4 address
nmgr.networkDiagnostics.arp.info: The Address Resolution Protocol (ARP) is a local network protocol that maps an IP address to its corresponding physical (MAC) address. In complex network environments, such as load-balanced systems, an IP address may have multiple MAC addresses associated with it. ARP can also be used as a diagnostic tool to check if a device on the network is reachable.
nmgr.dhcpSettings.title: DHCP settings
nmgr.dhcpSettings.useDnsInfo: DNS servers received from the DHCP server will be used. These have a higher priority than all statically configured DNS servers.
nmgr.dhcpSettings.useNtpInfo: NTP servers received from the DHCP server will be used for time synchronization. These have a higher priority than all statically configured NTP servers.
nmgr.dhcpSettings.useMtuInfo: MTU received from the DHCP server will be set as the MTU of the network interface.
nmgr.dhcpSettings.routeMetricInfo: This value will be used as the default metric for automatically added routes.
nmgr.dhcpSettings.routeMetricError: Enter a valid route metric between 1 and 9999

nmgr.network-manager.bridge.hint: Available are Ethernet and bridge interfaces that are not already used by another interface and are not configured externally
nmgr.firewall.label: Firewall rules
nmgr.firewall.info: Firewall rules are specific instructions configured in a firewall to control and filter network traffic. These rules determine which types of traffic should be allowed or blocked based on various criteria such as source and destination IP addresses, port numbers, protocols, and other characteristics. Firewall rules are designed to ensure network security by blocking unwanted traffic and allowing authorized traffic.
nmgr.networkDiagnostics.tcpdump.label: TCP Dump
nmgr.networkDiagnostics.tcpdump.info: TCP Dump is a network packet analyzer that captures network traffic in real time. It enables users to monitor packets transmitted over a network, providing details such as IP addresses, ports, and protocol information. Widely used for troubleshooting and network analysis, TCP Dump assists in diagnosing connectivity issues, detecting security threats, and verifying protocol behavior.
nmgr.networkDiagnostics.tcpdump.note.sto: When selecting '/tmp' for storage, up to 30 MB of data can be stored.
nmgr.networkDiagnostics.tcpdump.note.dur: The duration specifies the time period during which traffic will be captured, enabling you to focus on specific network activity within that timeframe.
nmgr.networkDiagnostics.tcpdump.note.ext: For further analysis, please download the TCP Dump file and analyze it with an external tool.
nmgr.networkDiagnostics.tcpdump.duration: Duration must be integer and greater than zero.
